newsitem.title: USA: Banyan Mortgage gets buyout proposal.
newsitem.headline: Banyan Mortgage gets buyout proposal.

text.p: Banyan Mortgage Investment Fund said Tuesday it was reviewing an unsolicited acquisition proposal from D. Andrew Beal, the principal stockholder of Beal Financial Corp.
It said the offer is for about $24.1 million or $0.51 per share.
Banyan Mortgage ended trade Tuesday at 30/64, up 2/64.
Banyan President Leonard Levine said the proposal neither specifies the manner in which Beal or his affiliated entities would bring about the acquisition nor indicates how it would be financed.

Levine added that the proposal is subject to due diligence as well as negotiation and execution of transaction documents. He said Beal requested up to 15 working days to complete its due diligence review.

Banyan said information provided by Beal states that he is the principal stockholder of Beal Financial, a privately held bank holding company with $1.3 billion in assets and earnings for the 12-month period ended June 30, 1996 of $44 million.
Banyan is a real estate investment fund.
